==> Shogo - Mobile Armor Division MAD-.direct.play.request.- <==

=======-> ripped: nothing  <-===+===->  added: updated <-=======

note: this game is a bit older as others(2oo1), its has been fixed to work on WinXP. i dont know if this will work on V(p)ista too.you may check that out 
by yourself!.



<->( about )<-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><->

Shogo: Mobile Armor Division invites you to strap yourself in to a 
multi-ton, heavily armored, armed to the teeth MCA that moves like 
quicksilver but destroys like a wrecking ball.

Or take a leisurely walk through a heavily guarded enemy facility with 
just your wits and a pistol in each fist. We do recommend that you pickup
the TOW rocket launcher or other assorted weaponry if you happen to 
find it lying around.

- Combat on foot in some missions, in a giant mech in others
- Scalable graphics allows this game to run on a tin can
- Great fun robot combat in lans
- and alot more...



<->( Hardware Requirements )<-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><->

this game has been fixed to work with windows xp, and does not
need high end PC to run smooth!. enjoy!



<->( how to play )<-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><->

1.: Unrar with WinRar ( newest! ) ... or use 7zip.

2.: double click: launch-shogo.exe ( must be done )

3.: double click: makedesktopIcon.exe and run game with.



<->( general hints )<-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><->

Trojan/Virus is a bold word to use without proof, you should NEVER 
throw that word around public forums without some back.
think twice about.


read everything carefuly, especially the following below ...
 


<->( Special Info )<-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><-><->

Some virus-scanner recognize the header of a packed .exe file , in this

case its the file > launch-shogo.exe < as a lame virus, because its  

the byte by byte check error of some virustools!. ( h e u r i s t i c s  ) but... 

Its almost certainly a false positive alert from overly protective heuristics,

you can read more about in your VirusTool-Manual or VirusTools-WebSite!.

(heuristics). you can also upload the file to certain websites to let them test.

with this result...> a false positive alert from... < if you dont believe , then

simply stay away, and dont come up with nonsense. thank you for reading!.
